intro.caption: Learning about new technologies is important for me and for my job as CTO of MÃ¼hlemann & Popp. So one of my favourite activities (besides playing strategy games with my kids and making long open water swims) is to complete small tech projects. Even better if they are useful.

goetterstammbaum.title: GÃ¶tterstammbaum
goetterstammbaum.caption: Interactive graph showing 170 greek gods. Assembled together with my son, as after reading Percy Jackson he's fascinated by the greek gods.

doorbell.title: Multisound-Doorbell
doorbell.caption: Play with our web based multi-ringtone doorbell we have installed for our coworking-space on this website.

meetingroomdisplay.title: Meetingroom Display
meetingroomdisplay.caption: The 3 meetingrooms in our office display their current availability via old iPhone 4 connected to a Google Calendar.

bronzehouse.title: 3D print of our house
bronzehouse.caption: For my wife's birthday I created a 3D printed bronze model of our house (she designed btw).

presencedetector.title: Bathroom occupancy detector
presencedetector.caption: Device for the MÃ¼hlemann&Popp AG/Eveni.to office. Tells us whether the bathroom is occupied or not (Like in the Swiss trains). Saves us unnecessary walks to the bathroom.

highwaysim.title: Highway Simulator
highwaysim.caption: This little app is a simple simulator of cars on a highway. Each car has a small AI engine. Play with the parameters or stop any car by touching it.

lasertiming.title: Laser Timing
lasertiming.caption: My kids love to make running competitions in the front of the house. Daddy loves to build gadgets. So I built a laser-controlled timing device. You hit the start button. The kids run. Every time they interrupt the beam the Arduino records the current time.

kitchendisplay.title: Kitchendisplay
kitchendisplay.caption: Second life for my old Smartphone: An information display in our kitchen showing tons of informations like my my current location, air quality, nice instagram pictures etc.

emailstat.title: 26'206 Mails on one graph
emailstat.caption: All the emails sent by me during the past 5 years shown in one graph. Each represented by a dot. The color of the dot represents the domain name.

sensio.title: An Sensio clone
sensio.caption: Vacations + 5 kids in the house + geek dad + ATMega328P = A self made Sensio clone

wateralarm.title: Prevent a basement flood
wateralarm.caption: Ready for the next thunderstorm: I finished my hardware hack (Well, the prototype). An Arduino based water detector which notifies me as soon as the water level in the shaft next to our house is about to flood our basement (happened before).

penguins.title: Solve the penguin puzzle
penguins.caption: An attempt to show my kids how a computer can solve their puzzle (and a fun coding task for dad). They actual problem solving takes about half a second to try 1297 combinations.

aegeriseelauf.title: Visualize race result
aegeriseelauf.caption: I wanted to learn about D3.js so I scraped the results of a race I participated in and visualized it in a dot graph. Can you spot the famous Swiss runner Viktor RÃ¶thlin?

blog.title: My (old) blog
blog.caption: In the years 2006 to 2010 everyone had to have a blog. So I had one too. And one article was particularly popular. That's where I compared 9 different email obfuscation methods. That article was featured on Reddit and get still hits now.

bikeamp.title: A bicycle amp
bikeamp.caption: This vacation I built a amplifier with speakers to attach to my bike. So everyone on the street can enjoy when I play Pump up the Jam, Ride on time or Back to life. I will be the coolest guy at school ðŸ˜‰
